item.title: Structured Correlation — Math & Geometry Test
item.description: +++ In this post we’ll see how equicorrelation and a one‑factor model both guarantee a positive‑definite correlation matrix—and we’ll exercise Hugo’s math renderer at the same time. 1 Equicorrelation If n assets all share the same pair‑wise correlation $p$, the matrix is $$ R(p)= \begin{pmatrix} 1 & p & \dots & p\[2pt] p & 1 & \dots & p\ \vdots & & \ddots & \vdots\ p & p & \dots & 1 \end{pmatrix}.

item.title: Test Math Rendering
item.description: In this post, we’ll test mathematical notation. Inline math: We can write an equation like $E = mc^2$ directly in the text. Display math: $$ \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2},dx = \sqrt{\pi} $$ More complex expressions: $$ f(x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{(-1)^n}{(2n+1)!} , x^{2n+1} $$ Enjoy testing math!
